intro: Phytolacca octandra var. grandifolia, commonly known as the red root or Indian ink plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its smooth, reddish stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into glossy, red berries. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often containing a toxic sap that can cause skin irritation. This species is native to the southeastern United States and is often found in moist, wooded areas.
